posts.cooked:
MacRumors

Telegram Beta Becomes First Third-Party App to Use Announce Messages With Siri

The latest beta of messaging app Telegram supports Apple's Announce Messages with Siri feature on AirPods, allowing users to listen and reply to...

The Signal team will most likely never do this based of their feelings about other iOS features. But just like Share Sheet Suggestions, CarPlay support, and Siri support these are features that I want added to the app. This is really a dealbreaker when messaging people when I can see every other application available including WhatsApp but not Signal. Please add support for announcements with Siri and share sheet support. And for the people that do not want these features for whatever reason have a switch available just like the switch available for phone App Call History integration.

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked:
No signal should be as cut off from the os as much as possible. The number one feature is properly applied encryption and as much security as possible following zero trust principal.
You are asking for a back door into the app the main reason why we use signal is to minimize attack surface.
Do not send messages while driving please even using voice.
It already looks like you use multiple messengers that do that, why do you want apple to intercept all your secure comunications?
Telegram is exactly the same thing as facebook that’s why you can do that.

Just like every feature it will be opt in and they will do research/communicate with Apple to see what data is actually transmitted. Text to speech is done on device the only thing actually sent to Apple is possibly the reply but even now with iOS 13 they have some dictation that is done on device.

“By default, your On-Device Dictation transcripts and audio are not sent to Siri servers. You can opt in to share this data with Apple to improve Siri and Dictation by going to Settings Privacy Analytics & Improvements and tapping to turn on Improve Siri & Dictation.” -Apple privacy policy for Siri

And I guarantee you people are already using the dictation feature that is built-in to the keyboard. There is no real reason to prevent people that understand the privacy implications and want more accessibility and/or convenience. That does not make privacy/security any less important for the Signal team. And for the people that need the most privacy the features are off by the default as always, just like in the case for link previews and share sheet suggestions.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
CodeRoachesAlumni:

And for the people that need the most privacy the features are off by the default as always, just like in the case for link previews and share sheet suggestions.

Both of the features you mentioned are on by default for “new” users (whose first version of Signal was the one where the respective feature was introduced or newer) — see SSKPreferences.swift#L24-L27 and L54-L57. They are off by default for “old”/“existing” users though (GRDBSchemaMigrator.swift#L138, L140).

link_counts.title: "Generate link previews" should be a setting listed under privacy, with some explanation about possible implications
Please add an amendment to the blog post about link preview privacy

posts.cooked:
I’ve only ever experienced it as an existing user having to turn on the features when they bring new features in.

I would recommend that you make a new forum thread under iOS a section asking that all features should have a default state of off in the code. Just for peace of mind. This should be the same for new user and existing users.

That’s the beauty of an open source project like signal is that you can communicate with the devs through this forum.

I miss spoke in the previous post. It seems Apple will automatically support announcements with Siri with all notifications.

If someone on the iOS 15 beta can try this out to see if it works and that you can also reply that would be great.

Helpful links: Send communication and Time Sensitive notifications - WWDC21 - Videos - Apple Developer
(Last 5-10 minutes explain Siri intents for these notifications.)

CodeRoachesAlumni:

user

That’s correct! However support from Signal team is needed to take action on the notification, for example, replying to a message. I tried replying to a message this morning and Siri tells me that signal has not implemented support to reply to the message via voice and that I need to do take out my iPhone to do so.

Concur, this is a flat-out blocker to wider adoption. I personally use Android, but one of the goals of Signal is to be a cross-platform alternative. Hopefully this could be done in a way that Apple doesn’t get access into Signal, but Signal can choose to push some info (eg text of message and/or who sent it) out of its secure domain into Apple for announcement. Maybe could even be a per-chat enable.
I actually get my signal message notifications on my latest ios beta through siri
